oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A SLOPING DUCT FOR THE STUDY OF SEDIMENT TRANSPORT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Damgaard, Jesper S.
Whitehouse, Richard J.S.
Soulsby, Richard L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sediment transport
sloping duct
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The details of a large sloping duct at HR Wallingford Ltd. are presented. The duct is capable of sloping to the angle of ±33° which exceeds the angle of repose of normal quartz sand. The duct can be tilted laterally as well as longitudinally so that; 1) the effect of combined slopes can be investigated; 2) the aspect ratio can be inverted. At present the duct operates with a steady flow but it can accommodate a wave piston.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
